DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to information regarding the previous antibody use of treatment to boost or restore the ability of the immune system to fight cancer, infections, and other diseases.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the previous antibody use of treatment to boost or restore the ability of the immune system to fight cancer, infections, and other diseases.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Therapy that designed to induce changes of patient's immune status in treatment of disease. The concept encompassing various treatment modalities including active and passive immunization, treatment with immunopotentiators, immunosuppressants and nonspecific systemic immunostimulators and adjuvants, desensitization to any allergens, bone marrow transplantation, thymus implantation.

Concepts.definition: Therapy designed to induce changes in a patient's immune status in order to treat disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring prior to something else.:A protein made by plasma cells (a type of white blood cell) in response to an antigen (a substance that causes the body to make a specific immune response). Each antibody can bind to only one specific antigen. The purpose of this binding is to help destroy the antigen. Some antibodies destroy antigens directly. Others make it easier for white blood cells to destroy the antigen.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A type of protein made by B lymphocytes in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody only binds to a specific antigen, helping to destroy the antigen directly or by assisting white blood cells to destroy the antigen.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: released as part of draft content review;SD 12/21/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had prior the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior therapy with nivolumab or with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody, or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune check point pathways?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient being treated with PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitors, CDK 4/6 inhibitors, or other immune-based therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1 or anti-CTLA-4 therapeutic antibody or pathway targeting agents

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1 or anti-CTLA-4 therapeutic antibody or other similar agents

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior therapy with pembrolizumab or epacadostat?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, or anti-CTLA-4 therapeutic antibody or other similar agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient previously receive anti-CTLA-4 antibody therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received an immune checkpoint blockade (e.g., a PD-L1/PD-1 inhibitor or a CTLA-4 inhibitor)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior anti-PD1/PD-L1 therapy given in combination with chemotherapy or radiation therapy in adjuvant or primary metastatic/recurrent settings?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient currently receiving treatment with an immune checkpoint inhibitor?
